meanings.definition: Comparative form of draff: having the most draff.
meanings.sent1: The draffiest part of the meal was the burnt toast.
meanings.sent2: She always picked the draffiest apples from the basket.
meanings.sent3: The draffiest piece of cake was left untouched at the party.
meanings.sent4: His room was the draffiest in the entire house, with old posters peeling off the walls.
meanings.sent5: The draffiest student in the class struggled to keep up with the others.

meanings.definition: Superlative form of draff: having the least value or quality.
meanings.sent1: Out of all the paintings, that one is the draffiest.
meanings.sent2: The draffiest fabric tore easily with just a slight pull.
meanings.sent3: The draffiest joke of the night made everyone burst into laughter unexpectedly.
meanings.sent4: Her old car was the draffiest vehicle in the parking lot, barely running.
meanings.sent5: The draffiest book on the shelf had missing pages and a torn cover.
